lines.text: never get less than twelve hours sleep; never play cards with a guy who has the same first name as a city; and never get involved with a woman with a tattoo of a dagger on her body. Now you stick to that, and everything else is cream cheese.
Hi. I'd like a keg of beer please?

[looking at a newspaper]
You don't say.
Yeah. How much is that?
You little bastards just don't give up, do you? Listen, no I.D. no goddamn beer. Can't you get that through your thick skull?

[his eyes turn red and his voice changes]
Give me, a keg, of beer.
[the clerk steps back in fear and go gets a keg, then Scott turns back to normal holding a thing of licorice]
And these.

Look Scotty, I know what you're going through. Couple years back, a kid came to me much the same way you're coming to me now, saying the same thing that you're saying. He wanted to drop off the team. His mother was a widow, all crippled up. She was scrubbing floors. She had this pin in her hip. So he wanted to drop basketball and get a job. Now these were poor people, these were hungry people with real problems. Understand what I'm saying?
What happened to the kid?
I don't know. He quit. He was a third stringer, I didn't need him.
What is it, gambling? Drugs? You know I'd really like to help you but I'm kind of tapped out this month. The IRS is coming down on me like it's some personal vendetta against Bobby Finstock.

[during party games]
OK, Chubby. What you've got to do is eat this entire bowl of jello.
[Chubby makes a face as if to say "No problem"]
What do I have to do?
Hold the jello!
[he tips the bowl of jello down her top]
Styles, I got something to tell you. It's kind of hard, but...
Look, are you gonna tell me you're a fag because if you're gonna tell me you're a fag, I don't think I can handle it.
I'm not a fag. I'm... a werewolf.
I want you to leave my son alone. He's a good kid... he's just having a tough time right now. Okay?
I was hoping it would pass you by.
Well, Dad it didn't pass me by. It landed on my face.

[upon seeing each other as werewolves]
An explanation is probably long overdue.
An explanation? Jesus Christ, dad! An explanation? Look at me! Look at you.
It's not as bad as it looks.
Wait a minute, wait a minute, dad. You mean you knew about this? You knew about this and you didn't tell me?
I was hoping I wouldn't have to. Sometimes it skips a generation. I was hoping it would pass you by.
Well, Dad it didn't pass me by. It landed on my face. What the hell am I gonna do?

[Scott slams his bedroom door behind him]
Scott, we really need to talk about this.
Forget it, dad. I don't want to talk. Go away.
Never say die.
It doesn't matter how you play the game, it's whether you win or lose. And even that doesn't make all that much difference.
Listen, Stiles. Do you know anything about a rash that's going around?
Why, you looking to catch something?
No, I'm serious.
No... but I heard Mr. Murphy, you know, the shop teacher?
Yeah?
Got his dick caught in a vacuum cleaner.
You want to forfeit the game?
Yeah, what's wrong with that?
No.
No?
My players have league scoring records at stake. It wouldn't be fair to them.
I just thought figured you quit now, you can beat the 5 o'clock traffic.
There's a lot to learn from losing.
Alright, we'll play, if it's that big a deal to you.
It's not going too well is it?
Well, Christ, Thorne, look at the sneakers those guys are wearing. If our guys had sneakers like that there's no telling what they could do.

[admiring himself in the mirror]
You are an animal! Woo!
[Scott is at the party and approaches Pam]
[to Pam]
Are you looking for someone in particular?

[to Scott, sarcastically]
Not you!
[walks off]

[to Scott drinking a beer]
There you go! She said two words to you.

[to Scott]
What do you think about to get worked up?
Do the right thing.
That's all I wanna do, Stiles. That's all I wanna do.
You may think that you are special here... but let me remind you that I am still the vice principal.

[In full werewolf mode and wearing sunglasses]
Hey, I'm no different than anyone else.
Give me a keg of beer... and these.
How am I going to put this to you? Uh... look at it this way. No wolf, mmm, no wolf, ahh, no part. What do you think?

You don't scare me, freak. Underneath all that hair, you're still a dork, Scott. I've handled your kind before. Your mama used to steal chickens out of the backyard until I blew her head off with a shotgun. Right, Scott?
Awful far from your side of the building aren't you, Howard?
No. I mean ye-yes, sir but the halls were wet.
Let me see your hands.

[nervously]
Sir?
Let me see your hands.
[Scott shows Thorne his hands, he sighs]
You wouldn't happen to have a marker on you, would you?
Listen son. You're going to be able to do a lot of things the other guys aren't.
Oh yeah, like chase cars, and bite the mailman?
[Rehearsing for the school play]
Sergeant, burn the fields and when you're done with that, burn the house.
I was with Stiles this afternoon.
I know.
You saw?
Yeah, I saw, unless that was another werewolf doing a handstand on top of Stiles' wolfmobile and making a fool of himself.
Shoot it, Fatboy.
These waves are mine.

[his car is speeding by]
Boof, how the hell are you?
Say no.

[to Stiles]
No!
Great talking to you.
